FK.content: phallus, the marionette, virtuality of virtuality, distinct from penis: parade fetish, the healthy, the automatic sur-viving, faith in most living as dead
FK.linkedContent: phallus, the marionette, virtuality of virtuality, distinct from penis: parade fetish, the healthy, the automatic sur-viving, faith in most living as dead

FK.linkedContent: machine, mechanics, reproduces the dead in the living; the marionette, the dead machine, automation acc. phallic effect

LOBL.content: everything that preserves the dead: sculpture, mask, embalm
LOBL.linkedContent: everything that preserves the dead: sculpture, mask, embalm

LOBL.content: embalm [fetish?], set about the arrêt de mort in its double triumph: effigy, chambers of this desire in a sort of “funeral home” > [Blanchot’s narrator] loves them dead, he loves (by) seeing them dead
LOBL.linkedContent: embalm [fetish?], set about the arrêt de mort in its double triumph: effigy, chambers of this desire in a sort of “funeral home” > [Blanchot’s narrator] loves them dead, he loves (by) seeing them dead

H.content: p. anne 102 the dead, the corpse, are the most easily read, manipulated [?]
H.linkedContent: p. anne 102 the dead, the corpse, are the most easily read, manipulated [?]

SPOM.content: “exorcism consists in repeating in the mode of an incantation that the dead man is really dead,” nothing more sure than that what is dead is dead
SPOM.linkedContent: “exorcism consists in repeating in the mode of an incantation that the dead man is really dead,” nothing more sure than that what is dead is dead

SPOM.content: “this is dead” means I am killing it, I dream of killing, thus: it is alive
SPOM.linkedContent: “this is dead” means I am killing it, I dream of killing, thus: it is alive

SPOM.content: [re: dominant discourse on Marxism] the triumphal stage of work of mourning, maniac, jubilatory, animistic magic, rhythm of cadenced march [“Marx is dead,” long live capitalism]
SPOM.linkedContent: [re: dominant discourse on Marxism] the triumphal stage of work of mourning, maniac, jubilatory, animistic magic, rhythm of cadenced march [“Marx is dead,” long live capitalism]

SPOM.content: conjuration, work of mourning: make sure dead will not come back
SPOM.linkedContent: conjuration, work of mourning: make sure dead will not come back

SPOM.content: vigilance, therefore: the dead is perhaps not as dead as conjuration deludes us into believing
SPOM.linkedContent: vigilance, therefore: the dead is perhaps not as dead as conjuration deludes us into believing

SPOM.content: Marx’s revolutionary injunction “let the dead bury the dead”, the imperative of an “active forgetting,” as Nietzsche would put it
SPOM.linkedContent: Marx’s revolutionary injunction “let the dead bury the dead”, the imperative of an “active forgetting,” as Nietzsche would put it

SPOM.content: neither the dead nor the living (the “only living,” the immortal living, the gods) have buried anyone (Marx knows this) > il faudra toujours que des mortels encore vivants enterrent des vivants déjà morts
SPOM.linkedContent: neither the dead nor the living (the “only living,” the immortal living, the gods) have buried anyone (Marx knows this) > il faudra toujours que des mortels encore vivants enterrent des vivants déjà morts

SPOM.content: Marx & Saint Max, heirs to Platonic tradition, associate image w/ specter, idol w/ phantasm, phantasma, eidola (Phaedo, Timaeus): living-dead, figures of dead souls > survival and return of living-dead as essence of the idol
SPOM.linkedContent: Marx & Saint Max, heirs to Platonic tradition, associate image w/ specter, idol w/ phantasm, phantasma, eidola (Phaedo, Timaeus): living-dead, figures of dead souls > survival and return of living-dead as essence of the idol

POOF.content: in Menexenus, must summon dead to be responsible before them, the dead are made to be born again: oath of this co-engagement thus resembles a fraternal conjuration
POOF.linkedContent: in Menexenus, must summon dead to be responsible before them, the dead are made to be born again: oath of this co-engagement thus resembles a fraternal conjuration

MSUBJ.content: Latin is stubborn, need to use words in order to express ideas that are clear; for me, ideas that are clear are dead > Descartes’ “clear ideas”
MSUBJ.linkedContent: Latin is stubborn, need to use words in order to express ideas that are clear; for me, ideas that are clear are dead > Descartes’ “clear ideas”

MSUBJ.content: subjectile interposes itself as the hymen btwn inside & outside, finally becoming the jetée (the spurt, a spurt like a fallen stone, dead) > objective, subjective, projectile, introjection, objection, dejection, abjection
MSUBJ.linkedContent: subjectile interposes itself as the hymen btwn inside & outside, finally becoming the jetée (the spurt, a spurt like a fallen stone, dead) > objective, subjective, projectile, introjection, objection, dejection, abjection

A.linkedContent: border of absolute arrivant keeps one from discriminating btwn figures of arrivant > the dead, the revenant (the ghost, he or she that returns)

A.content: Heidegger’s existential analysis has no competence for dealing w/ political problems of burial, cult of the dead
A.linkedContent: Heidegger’s existential analysis has no competence for dealing w/ political problems of burial, cult of the dead

MPM.linkedContent: with the dead, you can only speak “of” not “to” or “with”: la mort dans l’âme

MPM.content: the dead: receive nothing of what takes place in memory
MPM.linkedContent: the dead: receive nothing of what takes place in memory

MPM.content: the other is dead and nothing can save him from this death
MPM.linkedContent: the other is dead and nothing can save him from this death

MPM.content: the dead can no longer answer the call of the name, only in memory
MPM.linkedContent: the dead can no longer answer the call of the name, only in memory

T.linkedContent: after every perforation, one [philosophy] is dying to replace w/ a glorious cadaver, ce temps timbré entre l’écriture et la parole (s’) appellent un coup de donc [Glas]: it suffices, barely, to wait!

F.content: crypt of language: contract w/ dead, mort-gage, dead must pledge to occupy place as dead, must engage dying self alive
F.linkedContent: crypt of language: contract w/ dead, mort-gage, dead must pledge to occupy place as dead, must engage dying self alive

F.content: exquisite pleasure (nearing orgasm) disguised by repression as exquisite pain, le lieu where exquisite corpse has folded so much it appears flat > challenges us to exhume: “accuse-moi”
F.linkedContent: exquisite pleasure (nearing orgasm) disguised by repression as exquisite pain, le lieu where exquisite corpse has folded so much it appears flat > challenges us to exhume: “accuse-moi”

POS.content: keep at the limit, not the death, of philosophy, and besides, the dead wields a very specific power [Derrida does not believe in the death of whatever: God, book, philosophy]
POS.linkedContent: keep at the limit, not the death, of philosophy, and besides, the dead wields a very specific power [Derrida does not believe in the death of whatever: God, book, philosophy]

OTO.content: painfully difficult for life to become object of science, would require a philosophy of life, a whole politics, which inscribes the bio-graphical w/in the bio-logical
OTO.linkedContent: painfully difficult for life to become object of science, would require a philosophy of life, a whole politics, which inscribes the bio-graphical w/in the bio-logical

OTO.content: not the same for science of nonlife, of the dead, wins its claim to scientificity w/out delay: the co-implication btwn scientific object & the dead concerns desire to know
OTO.linkedContent: not the same for science of nonlife, of the dead, wins its claim to scientificity w/out delay: the co-implication btwn scientific object & the dead concerns desire to know

OTO.content: only the name can inherit, so the name is always a dead man’s name
OTO.linkedContent: only the name can inherit, so the name is always a dead man’s name

ATIA.content: the animort? pluralizing animal, renouncing unification of concept, so it can’t be opposed to anything identifiable (man, the dead)
ATIA.linkedContent: the animort? pluralizing animal, renouncing unification of concept, so it can’t be opposed to anything identifiable (man, the dead)

GSP.content: Husserl refuses to believe #s/math fall from heaven, pure Platonic idealism, but also refuses, when subjectifying math, to explain #s via “psychologism”: 1) distinguishes # from concept, psychological artifact 2) math irreducible to psychological temporality 3) designates an intentional dimension of objectivity, which no psychological genesis could institute [Frege would call this possibility a bloodless specter (blutloses Gespenst)?]
GSP.linkedContent: Husserl refuses to believe #s/math fall from heaven, pure Platonic idealism, but also refuses, when subjectifying math, to explain #s via “psychologism”: 1) distinguishes # from concept, psychological artifact 2) math irreducible to psychological temporality 3) designates an intentional dimension of objectivity, which no psychological genesis could institute [Frege would call this possibility a bloodless specter (blutloses Gespenst)?]

PS.content: for Artaud, furtive differance slipped in btwn 2 forms of writing, placing life outside the work, and making its origin (flesh) the epigraph, the breathless (essoufflé) sarcophagus of my discourse > only through writing made flesh, theatrical hieroglyphic, could double be destroyed
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, furtive differance slipped in btwn 2 forms of writing, placing life outside the work, and making its origin (flesh) the epigraph, the breathless (essoufflé) sarcophagus of my discourse > only through writing made flesh, theatrical hieroglyphic, could double be destroyed

O.content: Hegel: math has for its Stoffe dead space & lifeless numerical unit
O.linkedContent: Hegel: math has for its Stoffe dead space & lifeless numerical unit

DPi.content: red (on flag) as specter of the dead
DPi.linkedContent: red (on flag) as specter of the dead

REST.content: la nature morte, still life, dead nature

WAP.content: people haven’t noticed how often the dead return
WAP.linkedContent: people haven’t noticed how often the dead return

EJQB.linkedContent: to write: to confuse ontology & grammar; grammar: in which are inscribed all dislocations of dead syntax, all aggressions perpetrated by speech against language, every questioning of the letter

EJQB.content: all these tortures are forgotten in literature, as mortifications, as ruses of life
EJQB.linkedContent: all these tortures are forgotten in literature, as mortifications, as ruses of life

EL.content: the turn to everyday sacredness (secular Hebrew): miraculous manna but also profanatory jouissance > sorcerers: sinister masquerade, quasi Esperanto or Valapük, living dead in a shoddy resurrection used for commerce > evacuation & perversion of meaning

EL.content: the false cadaver will avenge itself its carnival disguises, its cadaverous instrumentality
EL.linkedContent: the false cadaver will avenge itself its carnival disguises, its cadaverous instrumentality

EL.content: for Scholem, for language to avenge itself against secularization: 1) it must be someone, bear the name of someone, remain attached to its creator 2) no iterability at source: technology is secondary or evil, can only befall (survenir) it [this exteriorizing of contamination is similar to Christian idealism, a spiritual interiorization separated from body, time, letter, carnal signifier]

EL.content: iconoclasm & idolatry at same time (if that’s possible): turn infinite value into a commercial one (both use & exchange)
EL.linkedContent: iconoclasm & idolatry at same time (if that’s possible): turn infinite value into a commercial one (both use & exchange)

EL.content: w/in “logic” of fetishism, no one ones who’s doing the fetishizing: Scholem or those he accuses? (via Enlightenment tradition prepared by Spinoza, it would be Scholem)
EL.linkedContent: w/in “logic” of fetishism, no one ones who’s doing the fetishizing: Scholem or those he accuses? (via Enlightenment tradition prepared by Spinoza, it would be Scholem)

C.content: it’s difficult to resist obsidional invasion (investissement) > 2 desires of coffin deal (traitent) w/ each other for the dead man: 1) to lie in it, to make it yours, to steal it, give birth in it, calm one’s terror of alterity 2) to let it be the other’s

C.content: tracking an exhumed body, in the wake’s wake (sillage), exultation of a funeral vigil, blackmail (faire chanter) the dead, Finnegans Wake > faire vibrer le sarcophage: sous le charme
C.linkedContent: tracking an exhumed body, in the wake’s wake (sillage), exultation of a funeral vigil, blackmail (faire chanter) the dead, Finnegans Wake > faire vibrer le sarcophage: sous le charme

C.linkedContent: paradigm as revenge: le mort se venge, “model” is always le revenant rêvé: haunting does not befall it, but takes the first step (la hantise ne lui survient pas, elle donne le premier pas)

C.linkedContent: stricture of coffins, holds dead man rigid, knotted w/in & w/out, pulls dans tous les sens (in all directions), seira, cord, chain, knotted cord

AD.linkedContent: via Levinas, the State left “to itself” only judges the dead or absent, no face present [Aristole’s Politics]

CF.linkedContent: only dead man can forgive—survivor not ready to substitute him/herself (immense, painful experience of survivor)

BSi.linkedContent: globalization of autopsic model, knowledge that de-vitalizes by looking at life (simple objectification) > the 2 senses of autopsia: cadaver & divine power

OG.linkedContent: via Rousseau, a written accent, “il n’y a là qu’un fard (makeup) dissimulant le cadavre de l’accent,” writing hides language, masks the already decomposed corpse of language

FV.linkedContent: [re: narrator identifying w/ Dupin in Purloined…] if dual relation btwn 2 doubles overflows & simulates symbolic: opposition imaginary/symbolic has little pertinence
